pullRequest.body:
* Add a bunch of missing `simp` and `norm_cast` lemmas.
* Get rid of `IsNontrivial œà` since it's just `œà ‚â† 1`. This simplifies proofs.
* Remove explicit arguments to `toMonoidHomEquiv`/`toAddMonoidHomEquiv`. We basically never need to provide them explicitly since unification usually does the job.


---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9517401302/job/26235908329)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9517401302/job/26235907976)
This is definitely an improvement, thanks!
Seems a bit strange to declare `{œà : AddChar A M}` as standing notation when it is only used twice much further down (most lemmas take the explicit argument)

I think that's okay. Furthermore since [I don't have cache](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/cache.20misses.20aesop) I won't adventure myself at removing `{œà : AddChar A M}` to put it only where needed.

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma coe_toAddMonoidHom (œà : AddChar A M) : ‚áëœà.toAddMonoidHom = Additive.ofMul ‚àò œà := rfl

@[simp] lemma toAddMonoidHom_apply (œà : AddChar A M) (a : A) :
```

```suggestion
  toAddMonoidHomEquiv.symm (œÜ.toAddMonoidHom.comp f)
```

```suggestion
    Injective fun (f : A ‚Üí+ B) ‚Ü¶ œà.compAddMonoidHom f := by
  rintro f g h
  rw [DFunLike.ext'_iff] at h ‚ä¢
  exact hœà.comp_left h
```
(readability)

```suggestion
lemma eq_one_iff : œà = 1 ‚Üî ‚àÄ x, œà x = 1 := DFunLike.ext_iff

lemma ne_one_iff : œà ‚â† 1 ‚Üî ‚àÉ x, œà x ‚â† 1 := DFunLike.ne_iff
```
I'm not convinced about this one. Putting the two next to each other shows that they are completely analogous. This is done in many place throughout mathlib
Fair enough

This is a bug, it seems. Without the fix, Lean successfully deduces that we must mean `MulChar.IsNontrivial`, because `AddChar.IsNontrivial` would not fit the arguments; but it still emits the deprecation warning for the declaration it _didn't_ use!

We should clearly get rid of `MulChar.IsNontrivial` too and then this will be moot; but the bug is worth reporting anyway, I think.
It's already known. See https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/issues/2132 (it might seem like a slightly different issue, but it is actually the same, as confirmed on Zulip by Mario)
I thought `$` was deprecated in favour of `<|` in mathlib
This is my reading of the style guide as well: "Note: while $ is a synonym for <|, its use in mathlib is disallowed in favor of <| for consistency as well as because of the symmetry with |>."
